pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.4.eng: Questions and answers on the monks’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis

pli-tv-pvr1.9:0.5.eng: The chapter on offenses entailing expulsion

pli-tv-pvr1.9:1.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattaṃ, kaṃ ārabbha, kismiṃ vatthusmiṃ …pe…
pli-tv-pvr1.9:1.1.eng: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of having sexual intercourse was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.1.eng: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of having sexual intercourse was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.6.pli: Sudinno kalandaputto purāṇadutiyikāya methunaṃ dhammaṃ paṭisevi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.6.eng: Sudinna having sexual intercourse with his ex-wife.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.8.eng: There is one rule. There are two additions to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe…
pli-tv-pvr1.9:2.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:3.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.9:5.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena adinnaṃ ādiyanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.1.eng: “The offense entailing expulsion that is a result of stealing was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.6.pli: Dhaniyo kumbhakāraputto rañño dārūni adinnaṃ ādiyi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.6.eng: Dhaniya stealing timber from the king.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:6.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.1.pli: Sañcicca manussaviggahaṃ jīvitā voropanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing expulsion that is a result of intentionally killing a human being. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū aññamaññaṃ jīvitā voropesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:7.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.1.pli: Asantaṃ abhūtaṃ uttarimanussadhammaṃ ullapanapaccayā pārājikaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing expulsion that is a result of claiming a non-existent superhuman quality. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.4.eng: The monks from the banks of the Vaggumudā.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.6.pli: Vaggumudātīriyā bhikkhū gihīnaṃ aññamaññassa uttarimanussadhammassa vaṇṇaṃ bhāsiṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.6.eng: Those monks praising one another’s superhuman qualities to householders.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:8.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:9.1.eng: The four offenses entailing expulsion are finished.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.0.eng: 2. The chapter on offenses entailing suspension, etc.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññatto, kaṃ ārabbha, kismiṃ vatthusmiṃ …pe…
pli-tv-pvr1.9:10.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down? Whom is it about? What is it about? …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.1.pli: Yaṃ tena bhagavatā jānatā passatā arahatā sammāsambuddhena upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.1.eng: “The offense entailing suspension that is a result of emitting semen by means of effort was laid down by the Buddha who knows and sees, the Perfected One, the fully Awakened One. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.6.pli: Āyasmā seyyasako upakkamitvā asuciṃ mocesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.7.eng: “Is there a rule, an addition to the rule, an unprompted rule?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.8.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.10.eng: “Is it a rule that applies everywhere or in a particular place?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.12.eng: “Is it a rule that the monks and nuns have in common or not in common?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.14.eng: “Is it a rule for one Sangha or for both?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.16.eng: “In which of the five ways of reciting the Monastic Code is it contained and included?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.20.eng: “To which of the four kinds of failure does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.22.eng: “To which of the seven classes of offenses does it belong?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.23.eng: The class of offenses entailing suspension.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.24.eng: “Through how many of the six kinds of originations of offenses does it originate?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.26.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe…
pli-tv-pvr1.9:11.26.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:12.4.eng: These were in India, the land named after the glorious rose apple.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.1.eng: These mighty beings of great wisdom,

pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.2.eng: Knowers of the Monastic Law and skilled in the path;

pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.3.eng: Proclaimed the Collection of Monastic Law,

pli-tv-pvr1.9:14.4.eng: On the island of Sri Lanka.”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.1.pli: Mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of making physical contact with a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmena saddhiṃ kāyasaṃsaggaṃ samāpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.6.eng: Udāyī making physical contact with a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.9:15.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.1.pli: Mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of speaking indecently to a woman. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmaṃ duṭṭhullāhi vācāhi obhāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.6.eng: Udāyī speaking indecently to a woman.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.9.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.10.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.10.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:16.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.1.pli: Mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of encouraging a woman to satisfy one’s own desires. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī mātugāmassa santike attakāmapāricariyāya vaṇṇaṃ bhāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.6.eng: Udāyī encouraging a woman to satisfy his own desires.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:17.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of acting as a matchmaker. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.6.pli: Āyasmā udāyī sañcarittaṃ samāpajji, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.9.pli: siyā kāyato samuṭṭhāti, na vācato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.9.eng: from body, not from speech or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.10.pli: siyā vācato samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.10.eng: from speech, not from body or mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.11.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca samuṭṭhāti, na cittato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.11.eng: from body and speech, not from mind; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.12.pli: siyā kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.12.eng: from body and mind, not from speech; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.13.pli: siyā vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na kāyato;
pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.13.eng: from speech and mind, not from body; or

pli-tv-pvr1.9:18.14.pli: siyā kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.1.pli: Saññācikāya kuṭiṃ kārāpanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of having a hut built by means of begging. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.6.pli: Āḷavakā bhikkhū saññācikāya kuṭiyo kārāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.6.eng: Those monks having huts made by means of begging.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:19.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.1.pli: Mahallakaṃ vihāraṃ kārāpanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of having a large dwelling built. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.6.pli: Āyasmā channo vihāravatthuṃ sodhento aññataraṃ cetiyarukkhaṃ chedāpesi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.6.eng: Channa having a tree that served as a shrine felled to clear a site for a dwelling.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:20.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in six ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of groundlessly charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.6.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ amūlakena pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.6.eng: Those monks groundlessly charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:21.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.1.pli: Bhikkhuṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñcidesaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of charging a monk with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.6.pli: Mettiyabhūmajakā bhikkhū āyasmantaṃ dabbaṃ mallaputtaṃ aññabhāgiyassa adhikaraṇassa kiñci desaṃ lesamattaṃ upādāya pārājikena dhammena anuddhaṃsesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.6.eng: Those monks charging Venerable Dabba the Mallian with an offense entailing expulsion, using an unrelated legal issue as a pretext.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:22.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in three ways: …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.1.pli: Saṅghabhedakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping with pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.6.pli: Devadatto samaggassa saṅghassa bhedāya parakkami, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.6.eng: Devadatta pursuing schism in a united Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:23.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.1.pli: Bhedakānuvattakānaṃ bhikkhūnaṃ yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of monks not stopping siding with one who is pursuing schism in the Sangha when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.6.pli: Sambahulā bhikkhū devadattassa saṅghabhedāya parakkamantassa anuvattakā ahesuṃ vaggavādakā, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.6.eng: Those monks siding with and supporting Devadatta’s pursuit of schism in the Sangha.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:24.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.1.pli: Dubbacassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping with being difficult to correct when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.6.pli: Āyasmā channo bhikkhūhi sahadhammikaṃ vuccamāno attānaṃ avacanīyaṃ akāsi, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.6.eng: Channa making himself incorrigible when legitimately spoken to by the monks.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:25.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.1.pli: Kuladūsakassa bhikkhuno yāvatatiyaṃ samanubhāsanāya na paṭinissajjanapaccayā saṅghādiseso kattha paññattoti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.1.eng: “There is an offense entailing suspension that is a result of a monk not stopping with being a corrupter of families when pressed for the third time. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.6.pli: Assajipunabbasukā bhikkhū saṅghena pabbājanīyakammakatā bhikkhū chandagāmitā dosagāmitā mohagāmitā bhayagāmitā pāpesuṃ, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.6.eng: Those monks, when the Sangha did a legal procedure of banishment against them, slandering the monks as acting out of favoritism, ill will, confusion, and fear.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:26.9.pli: kāyato ca vācato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti …pe….

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.1.pli: Anādariyaṃ paṭicca udake uccāraṃ vā passāvaṃ vā kheḷaṃ vā karaṇapaccayā dukkaṭaṃ kattha paññattanti?
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.1.eng: “There is an offense of wrong conduct that is a result of, out of disrespect, defecating, urinating, or spitting in water. Where was it laid down?”

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.4.eng: The monks from the group of six.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.6.pli: Chabbaggiyā bhikkhū udake uccārampi passāvampi kheḷampi akaṃsu, tasmiṃ vatthusmiṃ.
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.6.eng: Those monks defecating, urinating, and spitting in water.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.7.eng: There is one rule. There is one addition to the rule.

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.8.eng: Of the six kinds of originations of offenses, it originates in one way:

pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.9.pli: kāyato ca cittato ca samuṭṭhāti, na vācato …pe….
pli-tv-pvr1.9:27.9.eng: from body and mind, not from speech. …

pli-tv-pvr1.9:28.1.eng: The questions and answers on the monks’ Pātimokkha rules and their analysis, the first, are finished.
